intro: Stereospermum chelonoides, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, white, clustered flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant produces woody pods that contain flat, winged seeds, aiding in its dispersal. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warmer climates. Its rapid growth and ability to tolerate various soil conditions contribute to its adaptability and widespread cultivation.
